intro: Triumfetta brachistacantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaf triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow or white flowers. It typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
